name: Dr. Mattie Moss Clark
description: '''Mattie Moss Clark''' (born '''Mattie Juliet Moss'''; March 26, 1925 – September 22, 1994) was an American [[gospel music|gospel]] choir director and the mother of [[The Clark Sisters]], a gospel vocal group. She was the longest-serving international minister of music for the [[Church of God in Christ]] (COGIC). "Her arrangements, perhaps influenced by her classical training, replaced the unison or two-part textures of earlier gospel music with three-part settings of the music for soprano, alto, and tenor voice ranges—a technique that remained common in gospel choir music for decades afterward."
